lines.text: I think of what you do for me in Spain. I think I speak to you now. Maybe I understand better why you come here. This is my country, senor. These are my people, my gods. We not come tell you to stop loving your gods. We not come to make you slaves. Why do you do this, senor?
Well, I'm afraid I haven't any answer for that. It isn't right for men to worship idols. There's only one true God.
Maybe your God and my God same God. Maybe we just call him by different names.

[reacting to the torture of his sister]
I'll confess anything if you'll just release her!
No! Do not save her by a lie! Silva, if you do this thing, look to your own soul!
Senor el Supremo, the girl is dead!
You bumbling fools! Have you no skill in your craft?
God's love is a heavy burden.
Believe me, gentlemen, a lame goat takes no siesta. If something's got to be done, do it.

[finding Botello lying on the ground]
Botello, what happened?

[groans]
What misery! I'm lucky to be alive! Oh, my poor head!
But what happened?
You won't tell on me, Pedro lad?
Of course not!
I was just taking a stroll with one of those Indian ladies - ugly as sin, of course, color of mud, but charming, dear boy, charming.
You know the penalty for touching an Indian!
Now, now, Pedro, you know orders don't apply to a cockroach like me.
Even my skill cannot defeat the will of God, but I've stopped the bleeding. You'll have to admit it's a well-sealed wound!
[last lines]

Gentlemen, this time last year we were fighting mosquitos in swamps, accepting paltry gifts, and half-starving. But now we stand knocking at the very door of the great Emporer Moctezuma. We shall meet with His Majesty face-to-face - have done with ambassadors and specks of gold. This, gentlemen, is just the beginning!
